body: its because jellyfin changed the functions 'showLoading()' and 'hideLoading()'. They changed it to 'showLoadingMsg()' and 'hideLoadingMsg()'. I forked the project so I could help fix the plugin. I plan on sending the fixed configuration page soon. Working on fixing one last part.
The only thing left that i plan to try to fix is the hardware status section.
I have the some issue, waiting for the fix :)

## âœ… Fixed in v1.5.0.3!

This is the same issue as Discussion #38. I just released v1.5.0.3 which fixes the Save Configuration button.

**Root Cause:** Jellyfin page events weren't firing correctly on some systems, so the form submit handler was never attached.

**Fix:** Added robust event initialization with fallback mechanism.

**Update to v1.5.0.3:**
- Via Jellyfin Plugin Repository (recommended)
- Or download manually: https://github.com/Kuschel-code/JellyfinUpscalerPlugin/releases/tag/v1.5.0.3

After updating, the Save Configuration button should work! ðŸŽ‰
Closed as duplicate of Discussion #38. Fixed in v1.5.0.3.

v1.5.5 merge
1. Critical "Save Settings" FixFixed: Configuration settings now persist correctly after a restart.
Root Cause: The save button triggered a page reload that aborted the save process, and recent Jellyfin updates (10.9+) changed the loading spinner API (
showLoading
 vs showLoadingMsg), causing crashes.
Solution: Implemented robust async handling and added a compatibility layer for the loading spinner to support both old and new Jellyfin versions.
2. Improved Docker Connection Check

Fixed: The "Test Connection" button now uses no-cors mode.
Benefit: This allows the browser to verify if the Docker container is running (even on localhost or via tunnels) without being blocked by browser CORS security errors.
3. Hardware Status Correction

Fixed: The Hardware Status section previously displayed a hardcoded version (v1.4.8).
Solution: It now correctly reports the installed plugin version (v1.5.0.5).
4. Dynamic UI Improvements

New Feature: The "Scale Factor" dropdown now automatically updates based on the selected AI Model (hiding unsupported scaling options).
New Feature: Added a visual "Test Connection" button with color-coded status indicators (Green = Connected, Red = Failed, Yellow = Testing).
5. Installation Stability

Fixed: Corrected MD5 checksums in 
manifest.json
 to ensure the installation does not fail verification.

Does it work for any of you guys?

Maybe I am not understanding it fully, but:
The upscale-wrapper.sh script seems incapable of intercepting/talking to the docker image, considering that it requires an IP and a PORT. Look like it is made to talk to a local GPU, not sending transcoding chunks via IP/PORT.

For me personally it does nothing.
Mine works, but that may be because I am using a dedicated NVIDIA GPU.
Do you see any activity in the Docker logs?

Absent of anything in the logs (which I assume it has), I'm pretty sure the docker image does nothing and it just uses the local Nvidia GPU(it has only arguments for Nvidia), bypassing the docker completely.

@Kuschel-code , can you confirm or deny? Shouldn't the wrapper intercept the FFMPEG commands and delegate them to the docker? Or am I talking in complete misunderstanding of the situation?
